snippet: America and 11 other nations enter the final stretch of talks on lowering barriers.
abstract: Editorial warns hard bargaining lies ahead as officials from the United States and 11 other countries bordering the Pacific try to complete a trade agreement; holds deal should lower duties and trade barriers on most products and services, strengthen labor and environmental protections, limit governments' ability to tilt playing field in favor of state-owned firms and balance interests of consumers and creators of intellectual property.
lead_paragraph: America and 11 other nations enter the final stretch of talks on lowering barriers.
